context: The Finnish verb 'käyttää' is a very versatile word that primarily means 'to use'. It can also mean to employ, utilize or operate something. The form shown here is the present tense indicative, and it conjugates depending on the subject of the sentence. For example, 'minä käytän' means 'I use', while 'hän käyttää' means 'he/she uses'.  It can also refer to consuming something ('How much alcohol do you use per month?'), or even taking someone somewhere temporarily ('I took my kids outside for two hours').
